lines.text: Whoa, look, sir. Hey, I know I may be a little new at this but I don't think we shoot people for cheating on their taxes.
Oh. You're right. You are new at this.

[standing under the rear of a bull statue]
This is bullshit!

[after Lester fires gun at Brad, breaking his satellite phone]
I CAN'T BELIEVE YOU JUST SHOT AT HIM!
He had a gun!
HE HAD A PHONE!
Oh.
[lowers gun]
Well, this should discourage further violations of the tax code.

[screaming as she is sitting in a pile of manure surrounded by cows]
BRAD! BRAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAD!
What? Quiet. Those cows will jump on you.

[shrieks]
They will?

[rolls his eyes]
Stay there. I'll be right back.
What do you mean, "stay here", Br...
[squishes her hands right in a pile of cow waste. wails]
Eeeeeeeeeuuuuwww, I have COW POOP ON ME!
[sobs]

[after he has just suggested splitting fifty fifty of their estate, i.e. debt]
Fifty-fifty. Not on your LIFE!
Then it'll get UGLY.
Good! I can do ugly!
[turns and walks away]
I've done YOU for the last ten years!
...If memories serve, you stopped doing me after six and a half!... Happy anniversary, honey!

[offscreen]
FUCK OFF!

[dryly]
Okay.
How do you tell 'em apart? They all look alike to me.
This just keeps getting better and better!
45. We must have over-slept!
You're so lucky to not have a pre-nup.
We didn't have anything, there was nothing to nup.
Coffee? This is a coffee-drinking ordnun? Ohh, praise the Lord, sister.

[explaining to Henner why he always gets tounge-tied around Rebecca]
That's what women do to men. It's called "being in love".
So I went into Saks to get some socks, got a suit and some sex.
Hmm. It's actually soft over here.

[mutter]
Probably because you're sitting in cow dung.
Excuse me?

[aloud]
Uh... I said, "My oh my, is that cow hung."
You are such a pervert.
Good food, good meat. Good God, let's eat!
Well, after tonight, I don't know how I'll ever be able to face my friends again.
Just pretend they're a mirror.
You're so funny, honey. Actually, I'll just confess to them that I'm married to a MORON. And that way, they'll feel sorry for me and forgive me.
Well, this "moron" built you this fabulous life.
Oh, that again. Oh, I forgot. That's right, honey! You did EVERYTHING, and I did NOTHING.
Well, I have developed sixteen commercial properties in the last five years, including Euro-Alcatraz.
Oooooh... I'm sorry, did you say "Euro-Alcatraz"? "Vacation in... The Big House"? Say, did you hear that?
What?
The sound of an entire continent laughing at you?
[chuckles]
I know. You've done Bloomingdale's. You've done lunch. You've done chemical peels. You've done collagen. You've done liposuction.
[makes sucking noises]
Wowwww.
You poor, deluded little monkey. Who do you think brought you to these people? Hmm? Without me, Brad, you would be nothing.
[blows cigarette smoke in his face]

[sputters]
I beg your pardon, but I had a very successful real estate career before I ever met you.
I took you from K-Mart to Tiffany's. I invented you.
Okay. Well. Then I guess you have no one else to blame... but yourself.
That's -
[stops. Brad laughs, she groans]
I guess not.

[she walks away, he smirks after her]
Good NIGHT.
[they each retreat to their own separate sleeping quarters]
We are plowin' now!
[Somebody cuts Caroline's credit cards, she immediately blames it on Brad]
That BASTARD.
[Brad's account is frozen, he thinks Caroline is the guilty party]
That BITCH.
[Brad has just managed to crash their car - a stole taxi - into a lake]

[trying to help her out]
Are you all right?
No, I'm *not* all right, you *idiot*!
Come on!
Get out of my way! I'll do it myself!

[flailing her arms around]
Help! I'm drowning! Please, Brad, help, don't let me die!
Look, what's this gonna take, huh? Whaddaya need? Five bucks? A little Amish Lincoln?

[after both crash into Dunker's Pond and into the sunken taxicab]
I think I messed myself, sir.
Walk it off, son.
Today was a good day.
God only makes good days, Levinia.
Uh-oh. You've crossed over. You've become one of us.
Somehow, Caroline has managed to freeze all of my accounts.
Caroline? Are you sure?
Well, who the hell else would?
Well, there was that little IRS audit thing. I left out a few little details.
What sort of little details? FIVE MILLION DOLLARS?
[echoes throughout the bank]
Morning!

[referring to his new Shiastu 2000 chair]
What do you think?
I'll tell you what I think. I think thank you are spending development money on stupid toys.
These are not stupid toys! These are business tools! I write all this stuff off.
Oh, I would give you one more piece of advice. If I were you, I would leave town, because I-I think they're gonna arrest you.
Arrest me? Why?
Well, because, you know, it's not my name on those returns, Sluggo. It's yours. Have a nice day.
[hangs up; directing the cabby]
Kennedy.
